job_title: Emergency Department Technician in Knoxville, TN
pros: Management, culture, flexibility are all great.
cons: Pay is not very competitive.

review_title: Great facility and benefits but low pay
job_title: Certified Child Life Specialist in Knoxville, TN
pros: Employee clinic, weight room, employee pharmacy, sick days, massage therapist, cheap quality insurance, healthy culture.
cons: Low pay, work holidays, poor PTO policy (you have to take your PTO even on a holiday such as Christmas)

review_title: A good employer overall but poor pay and growth opportunities
job_title: Health Information Technician II in Knoxville, TN
pros: Great insurance and other perks, good people who care about kids, the company tries to make it a fun place for patients, families and employees.
cons: The pay has always been lower than average since I started working here but now with inflation in check, it’s a joke. Upper management is either oblivious to how many employees are now struggling to pay rent and groceries or they choose not to see it.

pros: Good management and staff, working with kids is great. Morale is pretty good, the CEO is great. People here really do love their jobs and care about kids.
cons: Very little negotiation for raises and inequality between nurse pay. There is a lot of nurse turnover because they cannot afford to stay when they can make so much more elsewhere.

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) in Knoxville, TN
pros: Good co-workers, pay, communication, fair rapport with RN's
cons: Short-staffed, management, lack of skill utilization, lack of training for.new employees, lack of available equipment, lack of supplies

job_title: CF Program Assistant  in Knoxville, TN
pros: Flexible hours, fair pay, great work environment.
cons: No cons really- I loved this job!

review_title: Working with children or UNDER children?
pros: Working with all of the children.
cons: Management is a joke. Coworkers have the attitudes of tantrum-ing toddlers. There is absolutely ZERO work/life balance as you are expected to be "on-call" even when you aren't on call. You are made to feel bad if you don't happen to answer your phone when you aren't working. You are guilted into working on shifts you aren't scheduled. Not to mention actual call is ridiculous. You are called in for EVERYTHING (including a splinter). If you have any inkling of wanting a life outside of work, RUN!

job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Knoxville, TN
pros: Everyone working here is very nice
cons: They do not pay nearly enough.

pros: Depending on who your manager is it's a good place to work. Insurance is the best part of of the benefits. 401k is a good match as well. PTO accruals are a pretty good benefit as well
cons: Management can be a hindrance because they tend to make decisions when they don't know the benefits or cons.

pros: Good company, depends on the floor you work

pros: Awesome company to work for, working with children is very rewarding

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Knoxville, TN
pros: The quality of care is excellent. People are kind and helpful everywhere. Staffing on units is good.
cons: There’s no extra pay for certification.

pros: The staff, the kids, the hospital.
cons: The pay is much less than other hospitals.

pros: Good institution, great benefits, there are many good people working there
cons: There are not many openings, so if you want to eventually move to a different shift than the one you were hired for, it may take a long time.

pros: Love the children.good pay,doctors and nurse were great to work with. Good benefits.
cons: Lots of drama. Rules dont apply the same to everyone. To much favoritism. HR doesnt do anything to help when you go to them with a ptoblem other than tell the person you went to talk to them about that you said something which causes  for a hostile work environment. They need to know that not all the upper management are fair or truthful and do retaliate against you for going to HR about them.  You feel like there is no where to turn when there is a problem. There were employees violating hippa in my department that were caught more than once and HR did nothing because they were the supervisors "pets" but others get written up or fired for hear say.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Knoxville, TN
pros: Good teamwork, healthy environment, and good orientation programs.
cons: Less competitive pay structure than other local hospitals.

review_title: Takes care of children... and their CEO's pocketbook.
job_title: Patient Service Representative in Knoxville, TN
pros: There is a good medical plan at ETCH. It costs considerably less than many other companies. With the on staff NP that you can see for illnesses, so you don't have to pay your copay at your doctor, it does help cut down on out of pocket medical expense.
cons: Favoritism of certain employees, managers not being held accountable for not treating their employees fair, higher up managers not concerned with the problems in these departments. Bad finance decisions for the company means that while they make 10 million dollar budget cuts and don't give employee raises (even though we are already the least paid in the area for the same jobs) two weeks later they announce yet another expansion that will cost 14 million. Not concerned about the people who run the hospital - only putting money in the higher ups pockets.

pros: Nothing that is worth working there
cons: Pay is absolutely TERRIBLE. Management does not control ANYTHING. Literally days after putting in my notice, there was a death in my immediate family. My boss told me that I could change my schedule as much as I needed to accommodate this. Then, I tried calling her for two days straight to try and figure out my schedule. She never called me back, even though I called over 5 times and left a message every time. I came into the office, and HR refused to answer my questions. And my boss basically told me that they were not going to be flexible or hospitable with my situation AT ALL. I have never been so poorly treated or so disappointed in a company in my life!

pros: Helping kids and families in time of need
cons: POOR MANAGEMENT (assigns employees to management positions based upon favoritism, NOT work ethic!), you are told you cannot use any sick time after you have put in your two week notice without the director telling you it was pre-meditated, management uses your complaints as a form of retaliation for most and awards others in the wrong, underpaid, hires individuals who are related to upper department management, no work life balance, no chance of advancing in your career within this department, etc.

pros: Teamwork.  Smart, collaborative, caring coworkers.  Very rewarding and intense field of work, I miss it often.  Usually good nurse-patient ratio (1:4 or 1:5) on a busy med-surg unit.  Always have supplies you need. Good health and dental insurance at a reasonable price.
cons: Short staffed at times. Sometimes patient acuity makes that 1:4 or 1:5 ratio very difficult. High stress environment. Very little sick time.

pros: Great benefits including health, dental ,vision, 403 B retirement plan . Rewarding job working with children. Direct management is great, but head management is about business and Durant make you feel appreciated. You can pick up extra shifts on different units if extra money is needed.
cons: Get pulled to other floors, hours were cut for a couple of months due to budget constraints,, on call hours and weekends.

pros: The insurance was really good (BCBS). Other than the insurance and being able to be around the kids not really any other pros.
cons: Raises were not good. Management was terrible. Always understaffed. Even though they say you can move around in the company the supervisors would block it so you couldn't be moved because they would say they are understaffed and couldn't let the employee go.

review_title: Patients get excellent service, but employee satisfaction with workplace leaves a lot of room for improvement.
pros: convenient and what Im trained to do. I like my field of work.
cons:
Too many managers.  Too much statistic gathering and not enough problem solving.
Changes are frequently made without employee input that results in poor results and confusion.

pros: Great atmosphere. Great teamwork in my department. Only freestanding pediatric facility in the area. Easy to work with scheduling. Great relationships between nurses and physician staff.
cons: Pay is low, but comparable to other area hospitals. Decent annual raises if evaluations are good every year.

pros: Good pay and hours if operation for food service jobs.
cons: Lazy coworkers.  Horrible management.  No respect from other departments.  You get treated like you work at McDonald's.

review_title: Great family atmosphere! Great place to work!
pros: Love the children and family centered care ! Love the family centered care approach ! Wouldn’t work anywhere else !
cons: Long hours short staffed floors at times / nightshift suffers the most with short staffed shifts  but the hospital tries to make up for it and help each other!

review_title: East Tennessee Children's Hospital is an awesome place to work.
pros:
-Supportive and understanding environment
-A cause you can believe in
-The kids are put first
-Leadership believes in staff
-Opportunities for growth
cons:
-It can be difficult to get to know people because it is so big
-Gap between medical and  non-medical staff

pros: The only good thing about the hospital is the patients.
cons: The pt units are usually so understaffed nurses and support staff have an obscene pt load that can be a safety issue. the nurse managers shouldn't be in management let alone nursing. And as far as pay goes the more u do the less u get paid and without any appreciation.

review_title: Overall a great place to work
pros:
Experienced and friendly staff
Privately owned
Great benefits
cons: Over the past couple of years there have been cutbacks on staffing as a result of LEAN productivity analysis. The atmosphere is growing more and more corporate.

pros: They treat their employees very well, great benefits, love my co-workers and they are always trying to improve job satisfaction.  they are very passionate about providing the best care for the children and their families.
cons: Parking can sometimes be a pain, and not many food choices for nights and weekend staff

pros: Regional free standing children's hospital. Some flexibility of scheduling. Coworkers are great. Benefits are good for the area.
cons: Administration is more interested in process of getting Magnet status than in actually taking care of their nurses. Most nurses feel like they are "stuck" there since it is the only children's hospital.

pros: Staff are motivated and really care for children. Management team involved in the community. Administration care for the staff, patients and families. Staff are making very good strides concerning diversity.
cons: Slower than desired diversity in administration and management.

review_title: Great Place to Care for Children
job_title: Patient Services Representative in Knoxville, TN
pros: Staff Nurses and physicians are dedicated to their patients.
cons: Management is a clique. Some departments are like middle school.

pros: Great flexibility wonderful management employer cares about employees and patients are number one.  Always looking for ways to make it a better place
cons: No cost of living raises

pros: 60 hrs every 2 weeks consider full time; good health insurance
cons: sick time is divided into short and long term, so you have very little short term

pros: Great reputation for a hospital
cons: Had to pay taxes on something I purchased for work, it was considered salary when I was reimbursed

review_title: Great place to work with great benefits!
pros: We get kids and love our jobs!!
cons: Pay could be a little better compared to other surrounding facilities.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Knoxville, TN
pros: cares about employees, doctors wonderful to work for
cons: management only cares about big picture, tries to apply hospital rules to outpatient practices

pros: Precious patient population! Hard working staff
cons: Short staff, inadequate training. Gossip and lack of professionalism in the workplace.

pros: Friendly co-workers and generous help
cons: Busy construction area makes it hard to park/figure way around

pros: You get to only work with kids
cons: Schedule is very difficult and pay makes it seem not worth it

pros: Great atmosphere, great people to work with, praised for good work.
cons: None really. Great place to volunteer!

pros: Friendly employees and willing to help.
cons: Weekend are up and down work flow.

pros: Loved my co-workers and interaction with children

pros: Good benefits, Flexible work schedule
